ch.epfl.alpano

Class Interval1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.alpano.Interval1D

  • public final class Interval1D
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a one dimensional interval of integers.

    A 1 dimensional interval defines a range of integers that are contained between a lower and upper value.

    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval1D(int includedFrom, int includedTo)
      Constructor to create a 1 dimensional interval with starting at the value of lower and includes all the integers up to and including upper.

    • Method Summary

      • boundingUnion

        public Interval1D boundingUnion(Interval1D that)
        Creates a new interval made of the smallest and biggest bound of the two interval (this is called a bounding union).
        Parameters:
        that - The interval you want to make the bounding union with.
        Returns:

      • isUnionableWith

        public boolean isUnionableWith(Interval1D that)
        Tells you if you can create an union (not a bounding one!) out of the two interval.
        Parameters:
        that - The interval you want to know if you can make an interval with.
        Returns:
        True/False if you can make the interval or not.

      • union

        public Interval1D union(Interval1D that)
        Gives you the union (not a bounding) of two interval.
        Parameters:
        that - The interval you want to create an union with.
        Returns:
        A new interval that is the union of this and that.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If you can not make an interval out of the two interval.
